segments.paragraph: Take a tour through the Example course by clicking the Edit button. The Example course is provided to show you how you can organize your lessons, badges, user levels, quizzes, and daily comments. Gameof5 will show you the Example course until you remove it and save your data to the cloud server.

segments.caption: Example course is provided to show you how to get started.

segments.paragraph: It is recommended that you remove Example once you have viewed it and start a new course from scratch.

name: How many courses can I register?
author: g5

segments.paragraph: You may register up to five courses at a time. Each course is connected to its saved data on the cloud server (i.e., lessons, badges) by the unique name you give it. Click the Save button to write your course data to the server.

segments.caption: Click the Register button to register a new course.

segments.paragraph: Removed courses are not deleted from the server, and may be re-registered using the original unique name (e.g., Example).

name: How can I create a lesson?
author: g5

segments.paragraph: You may add as many lessons as you like. After you Add a lesson, use the tools to provide detail and segments to organize the lesson progression. Lessons can be moved up and down in the course order (first lesson is presented on the bottom, most recent at the top) and deleted.

segments.caption: Completed lessons look like this to your users. They can be printed as PDF files.

segments.paragraph: When providing details, ensure you provide full URL path names (http://www.google.com) to your image or link. SVG vector graphics load faster than images (.jpg or .png) and can be shared for free on http://svgur.com. Keywords and expectations need to be separated with commas as they are each stored separately when saved.
Segments are the parts of the lesson. Add up to 5 (good teaching practice says less is more!) segments to organize your lesson.

name: How can I share my classes with students?
author: g5

segments.paragraph:
Students can enrol in your class by visiting a share link that you provide to them.
Enrolment process in a nutshell ...
  • Email students the share link
  • Students visit and bookmark share link
  • Refresh your gameof5 and View Users to confirm enrolments
  • Save course with Update checkbox checked to confirm users

segments.caption: Click the share icon to access the share link for your current course.
Student message when they first enrol.

name: What does the student view look like?
author: g5

segments.paragraph: After students have enrolled and you have confirmed them by saving, they can access their profile and data using the share link.

segments.caption: Confirmed students will see their profile, points, badges etc. as well as access course lessons.
Profile sections provide access to the data you have entered
